intro: Anoniodes parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered Anoniodes, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Annonaceae, which includes many species with aromatic and medicinal properties. The plant typically features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a follicle that contains a single, elongated seed. Anoniodes parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and wetlands.
